com.esri.mo2.map.dpy
Interface DisplayManager

All Known Subinterfaces:
ServerDisplayManager
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseDisplayManager, BaseServerDisplayManager
public interface DisplayManager

Manages the drawing of a Layerset's Layers to a particular Display.

Since remote data retrieval is asynchronous, a Map can choose to redraw portions of a Display with the result that multiple Threads may be required to redraw (usually separate) DisplayAreas. A DisplayManager manages these separate drawing threads.

If you want to cancel some of these threads individually, you will need to implement the DisplayListener interface, and manage the drawing thread handles made available in DisplayEvent. But if you just want to cancel all drawing threads at once, you will need to invoke the cancel method.

See Also:
DisplayListener, DisplayEvent, Layerset, Display

setExtentLimit

public void setExtentLimit(Envelope limit)
Sets the Display's map extent limit. Once you set this property, future drawing of the Map is confined to the specified Envelope, and LayerExtensions associated with Layers in this Map will retrieve data within the confines of this property. You can switch off this behaviour by setting the extent limit property to null. You must redraw the Map to see the change caused by this property.

Parameters:
limit - the new extent limit, or null == do not use an extent limit

getExtentLimit

public Envelope getExtentLimit()
Returns the Display's current extent limit. If you get null, then this means that the extent limiting behaviour has been switched off - which is the default when the software starts.

Returns:
the extent limit
See Also:
setExtentLimit(com.esri.mo2.cs.geom.Envelope)

isCancelled

public boolean isCancelled()
Determines if the DrawingThread within the current Thread has been cancelled. This method is called frequently within the Renderer code.

Returns:
true if cancellation has been detected, false otherwise
